programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: A saloon singer (Ann Dvorak) and her rival like a marshal (Randolph Scott) who cleans up a drunken sheriff's (Edgar Buchanan) cow town.

programme.title: Phantom Ranger
programme.desc: A federal investigator (Tim McCoy) poses as an outlaw to catch a gang of counterfeiters which has kidnapped a government engraver.

programme.title: The Red Rope
programme.desc: Ranch hand Tom Shaw (Bob Steele) must face off against a nefarious gunslinger to save his lady love's ranch..

programme.title: Arizona Thunderbolt
programme.desc: A circus performer (Joe Cook) and his piano-playing partner (Robert Cummings) go after a pair of ruthless rustlers.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: The agents investigate a hanging judge in Oklahoma for the state authorities.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Agents go to Washington territory to investigate an imposter posing as a U.S. Secret Service agent.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: General store clerk Herbie Bates, is name assistant general manager of the Shady Rest by Kate, making Uncle Joe feel like he is being replaced.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Uncle Joe becomes a justice of the peace with hopes of attracting honeymooners.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho hope to imprison the leader of a rustling ring.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A con man resorts to murder in a phony land promotion scheme.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The 1850s California gold fields is home to notorious bandit Joaquin Murietta; Matt and Frankie arrive to track him down but he kidnaps Frankie; Matt and Captain Love trail Murietta to the bitter end.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Tiburcio Vasquez vows vengeance against Anglos after his sister Dolores is killed; Matt and Frankie try to stop his years of terror in Southern California after a railroad agent is killed with the help of local priest.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Roy along with Taggart are intrigued by the arrival of Pat O'Hara and much younger wife Kate; Pat's fondess for drink and gambling has him involved with the town's rowdies.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Deputy Jeff Taggart is framed in the murder of a horse trader.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) challenges a mine owner's spoiled rich daughter (Maura Murphy) to a race. With Tom London.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: After being framed and serving seven years in prison, a bitter man (Harry Lauter) returns to town. With Gail Davis.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Fortune hunters seek a treasure rumored to have belonged to the French explorer La Salle; they ask Hawkeye to lead them but when he discovers that it is in a sacred Dakota burial ground he tries to dissuade them.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Lt. Briggs breaks the treaty by chasing an Indian beyond the recognized border; Led into an ambush he escapes but his militiamen are captured; Hawkeye and Chingachgook are assigned to escort him to his court-martial and probable hanging.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: The Cartwrights' neighbor (Franchot Tone), a former soldier and lawman, seeks security for his daughter.

programme.title: Days of Jesse James
programme.desc: A singing cowboy (Roy Rogers) clears the outlaw (Donald Barry) and his gang of a bank robbery done by bankers.

programme.title: Frontier Justice
programme.desc: A practical joker (Hoot Gibson) rescues his cattleman father from shady sheepmen.

programme.title: Hands Across the Border
programme.desc: A singing cowboy (Roy Rogers) helps a slain rancher's daughter (Ruth Terry) breed horses for the Army.

programme.title: Captain Apache
programme.desc: A full-blooded Apache working for the U.S. Army investigates a colleague's murder and uncovers a plot by a wealthy white farmer to instigate an Indian war; gunplay and bloodshed follow as the investigation deepens.

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: A baseball star (Lou Gehrig) goes west with his sister (Evalyn Knapp) and helps a lawyer (Smith Ballew) bust a cattle-protection racket.

programme.title: Riders of Destiny
programme.desc: Agent Saunders (John Wayne) becomes partners with Fay (Cecelia Parker) to help her fight off a gang run by a local land grabber.

programme.title: Adventures of Gallant Bess
programme.desc: A rodeo stunt rider (Cameron Mitchell) meets a woman (Audrey Long) who comes between him and his trick horse, Bess.

programme.title: The Kansan
programme.desc: The new marshal (Richard Dix) of a Kansas town cracks down on his sponsor, a greedy banker (Albert Dekker).

programme.title: Doomed Caravan
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy rides shotgun for a freight company and comes up against a gang of outlaws posing as cavalrymen.

programme.title: Born to Battle
programme.desc: Cattlemen offer a jailed cowboy his freedom if he will agree to help locate a gang of notorious rustlers.

programme.title: Broadway to Cheyenne
programme.desc: A New York police officer, shot and wounded by a gangster, travels to Cheyenne, Wyo., to recuperate at his family's ranch, and is surprised to find a bootlegger from New York running a speakeasy there.
